channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This car park is in private land and as had signs up when work was taking place on the photos, I can see road closure signs was put up and on the contractors barriers with notices 2-3 days when works were taking place in some cases emergency works needed to be taken to restore residence supply that had ongoing issues down the line, 9th June
item.description:
Private land car park
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Berkshire Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: All of Bonny Street North Side, 9th June
item.description:
All of the street lights in Bonny Street are not working. Someone was 'working' the lights at ground level yesterday, now none of them are on at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Bonny Street, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car park closed for 4 months without proper signage or notice Reported via mobile in the Parking signs category anonymously at 07:36, Tuesday 11 February 2025 Sent to Hackney Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7115518. The car park has been closed for 4 months with no obvious reason, no communication with the tenants, and nothing telling the tenants when it will back, there is disabled parking bay which the tenant can not use this unacceptable. Update Hackney Council manager needs training to learn how to engage with tenants and residents when work is scheduled., 9th June
item.description:
This is due to bad hackney housing manager not informing tenants, residents of any work or reasons why car park is suspensions why work is going on. Manager does not do hurt duty or reassure residents and competent manager needs training and people skills.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Berkshire Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge items outside my flat again!, 8th June
item.description:
Please arrange for them to be collected by Tuesday, 10th June as I am having a potential buyer coming over Tuesday afternoon. I hope you don’ t fail me again!!!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Close, London

item.title: Bush dumped on pathway of Elcot Avenue, 8th June
item.description:
There is a significant build-up of dead vegetation, litter, and even a bush flytipped on the pavement along this section of the Elcot Avenue . The debris includes dry twigs, overgrown weeds, and discarded waste such as a drink can, which is obstructing the walkway and creating a trip hazard. This area clearly hasn't been swept or maintained for some time and needs urgent attention to ensure pedestrian safety and maintain cleanliness in the neighbourhood. Please do a litter pick of the whole of Elcot Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 85 Marchmont street, 8th June
item.description:
Good evening, We have just signed a lease for a commercial property at 85 Marchmont Street, London WC1N 1AL. We’ve found out there’s a crack under paving slabs outside our new shop which is causing the water leak indoors. Is it possible for someone from the Council to come and investigate and fix the issue. We would really appreciate if this could be arranged promptly as we are not able to proceed with the refurbishment of the shop due to this issue. Thanking you in advance. Kind regards, Mounir Cherkaoui Owner of Lever & Bloom Coffee hello@leverandbloomcoffee.co.uk 07400133131

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Marchmont Street, Saint Pancras, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council staff leaving bags of waste for foxes to raid, 8th June
item.description:
Each time a blue bag of waste is left on or near this bin overnight, foxes rip the bag open and spread the contents over the street. Can I ask the council workers to stop doing this please.
